body_html:
@apaszke

Everyone can implement them in their projects in case they need it,

With this API, one can quickly query state of the state_dict (and one get full picture)
And doing this in code is a bit messy, why should we force everyone to find the difference keys manually every time they need it?

and it might even end up being faster in case you don't need one of the three sets we compute.
I agree here.

How about passing keys of interest and we only compute those?
But, I guess, if someone is using diff_state_dict, they are okay with extra time.

Also, now returning keys as set instead of converting into list.
Keys are supposed to be set, then why waste time in un-necessary conversion into list.

body:
@apaszke 
>>Everyone can implement them in their projects in case they need it, 

With this API, one can quickly query state of the state_dict (and one get full picture)
And doing this in code is a bit messy, why should we force everyone to find the difference keys manually every time they need it?
>>and it might even end up being faster in case you don't need one of the three sets we compute.
I agree here. 

How about passing keys of interest and we only compute those?
But, I guess, if someone is using diff_state_dict, they are okay with extra time.

Also, now returning keys as set instead of converting into list. 
Keys are supposed to be set, then why waste time in un-necessary conversion into list.
